title: Dozens of volunteers canvas Boston for homeless people outside as blizzard bears down on the city
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Pine Street Inn volunteers canvassed Boston during a blizzard, providing supplies and transport to shelters for homeless individuals.
Overnight teams encountered 50 people outdoors as a nor’easter brought over 16 inches of snow to Boston.
Pine Street Inn shelters, with a capacity of 585, accommodated over 660 people utilizing extra cots and mats as the storm hit.

title: 50 percent of departing Boston Logan Airport flights canceled Tuesday
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Over 50% of flights departing Boston Logan Airport were canceled Tuesday due to a powerful nor’easter.
Amtrak suspended service between Boston's South Station and New York Moynihan Train Hall amid severe weather conditions.
Nearly 270 flights for Tuesday were canceled and 14 delayed; travelers advised to confirm with airlines.

title: To trade or not to trade? Bruins must make their call with Viktor Arvidsson.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins must decide on trading Viktor Arvidsson before the March 6 NHL trade deadline.
Arvidsson, acquired for a fifth-round pick, has scored 14 goals and 28 points in 45 games this season.
Trading Arvidsson could affect the Bruins' playoff chances, as they hold a Wild Card spot with a 61% chance of advancing.

title: These Mass. schools are closed on Tuesday, Feb. 24.
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Over 30 inches of snow leads to widespread school closures across Massachusetts on Tuesday, February 24.
Boston and other major districts including Cambridge, Lowell, and Worcester announced closures due to the snowstorm.
Some school districts, including Athol-Royalston and Littleton, are operating on delayed schedules due to the storm.

title: AJ Brown recalls ‘critical’ Mike Vrabel moments that changed hatred to respect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: AJ Brown shared his evolving relationship with Mike Vrabel, initially writing 'I hate Vrabel' during team meetings.
Brown recounted Vrabel's coaching style, emphasizing player engagement and accountability during meetings and game analysis.
Brown, now with the Eagles, is speculated as a trade candidate for the Patriots, where Vrabel is currently coaching.

title: US women’s hockey declines invite to State of the Union, men’s hockey also invited in viral Trump phone call
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: US women's hockey team declined State of the Union invite due to scheduling conflicts after Olympic gold win.
The US men's hockey team, also gold medalists, received invites to State of the Union and White House event.
President Trump joked about inviting the women's team during a call to the men's team after their victory.

title: Patriots cut running back Antonio Gibson to save cap space
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots released running back Antonio Gibson, creating over $3 million in cap space.
Antonio Gibson, 27, was recovering from a torn ACL sustained in Week 5 of the 2025 season.
Gibson played 22 games for the Patriots, gaining 644 rushing yards and 581 kickoff return yards.

title: Yes, this storm is officially a blizzard. Here’s what meteorologists want you to know.
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Blizzard conditions declared in Massachusetts and Rhode Island, including Boston and Providence, as of Monday morning.
Blizzard criteria include visibility of 1/4 mile or less for three hours with sustained winds of 35 mph or greater.
NWS warns high winds could reach 75 mph, causing power outages, tree damage, and hazardous travel conditions.

title: Video captures blizzard conditions in downtown Boston
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Photographer Jack Coen captures fierce wind and snow conditions in downtown Boston during Monday's nor'easter.
Approximately 14 inches of snow accumulated at 1Lofts mill apartments in Pawtucket, R.I. early Monday morning.
National Weather Service warns of 18-24 inch snow totals with damaging wind gusts causing whiteout conditions in Massachusetts.

title: Tom Brady’s WWE comments have landed him at the top of Randy Orton’s RKO list
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tom Brady joked about WWE on Logan Paul's podcast, calling it 'cute' compared to real football competitions.
Randy Orton expressed interest in using his RKO move on Tom Brady after Brady's comments about WWE.
Brady and NFL stars like Saquon Barkley to compete in upcoming Fanatics Flag Football Classic with high expectations.
